page.title: 08HOUSES IN HORTON-CUM-STUDLEY
page.content: Most of the houses in the village have been built since 1960. They are constructed of brick or stone and are in small groups off the one through road - Priory Close, Ventfield Close, The Orchard, Forge Close and more recently Mill Lane. Several groups have won design awards for their architects. Most of the houses in the village have garages for one or two cars. Our survey showed that about 60% of the houses have some double glazing and most of the houses are heated by oil, although coal, wood and electricity are also used. There is no mains gas supply to the village. A few houses use bottled gas. Of the older houses there are still one or two thatched houses once so common in this village.
